DOC.brief_summary: Warts are benign epidermal tumors caused by human papillomaviruses (HPVs). The active pharmaceutical ingredient DPCP has been used for many years as a compounded formulation in acetone for the treatment of warts, alopecia areata and more recently, cutaneous metastatic melanoma lesions. An improved topical ointment formulation of DPCP called Samcyprone™ will be evaluated for the treatment of common warts.
DOC.brief_title: Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of DPCP Ointment (Samcyprone™) on the Clearance of Verruca Vulgaris (Common Warts)
DOC.criteria: Male and female subjects between the ages of 18 and 65 years of age, inclusive Subjects presenting with at least one verruca vulgaris (common cutaneous, plantar, and periungual) warts for at least 4 weeks, but no more than 3 years Subject's common warts for treatment must measure between 3 and 20 mm and be located on hands, feet, limbs and/or trunk. A maximum of four (4) cutaneous single warts or one (1) area of clustered or adjacent warts up to 80 mm will be treated Genital warts may not be selected as target warts Subjects that are immunocompromised Presence of systemic or localized diseases, conditions, or medications that could interfere with assessment of safety and efficacy or that compromise immune function
